text: Cut to a real moon. Then cut wide to a moonlit landscape, which the camera careens madly. The soundtrack, which was almost sacred in the mural chamber, erupts into a tribal glimpse creatures in the darkness, moving through the ree barely more than silhouettes. We see teeth, and gleaming glimpses of naked, patterned flesh. Only glimpses.

Cut back to the mural chamber. Now we have moved away fro to a more brutal scene. A symbolic representation of a gr apocalyptic war between Naturals and Breed. Terrible scen destruction. VOICE: But the Naturals made war on us. They feared us fo strength. They envied our powers. They called us monsters by whatever means their malice could invent, finding in e our particular vulnerability.  We are scanning scenes of that war. A breed being staked vampire. Another being shot like a werewolf. Another expo sunlight. VOICE: None of us was safe. The tribes of the moon dwindl gods were slaughtered, our homes destroyed. It was the Ap
Cut back to the landscape. The clouds roil above the head creatures heading through the reeds. We see their destina huge wall, with gates.

And back to the mural chamber, and a final scene. The gat just seen are in the painting. Looking over them, calling in, is a vast indistinct form: that of Baphomet. His eyes arms are open in welcome. VOICE: Only one of our Gods survived the holocaust. Bapho Wounded and near death, he summoned us, the last of the l hiding. Into Midian, where we wait now. The battle is ove the war. There will come a saviour. Now we've moved beyond the image of the gate into a new p wall on which the pictures are only vague sketches. We ca some of the images nevertheless: a man with a bloody hole middle of his chest. A man wearing a mask like a skull. W a faceless figure. VOICE: His name is Cabal. He will lead and give us back t We are the tribes of the moon. We are the Nightbreed. The titles end.

Cut back to the landscape. Now we are at the gates, and t creatures slip through and away into the mist. Only one, ferocious female called Shuna Sassi remains, turning to l She beckons. SHUNA: Come... The camera retreats from her. SHUNA: Will you not come? Now the last of the creatures, the Drummer, takes her by snatching her away through the gates. As she disappears, follows again, stopping at the gates themselves, which cl unearthly din.

C.U. on Boone, closed eyes. He is dreaming. His gaze rove his lids. Lori's lips come into shot kissing first his eyes and the down his face to his mouth. LORI: Boone...wake up. Boone's eyes flicker open. LORI: Hi. You OK? Boone: Yep. Now Boone's eyes are fully open. He sits up. Looks toward window. Night beyond. She kisses him, distracting him fro of the window. LORI: You want something to eat? BOONE: Sure. What time is it? LORI: Nine-thirty. I was letting you doze. BOONE: Thought you'd worn me out, huh? Lori smiles, and kisses him, then crosses the room to the area, picks up some fruit, and a knife, carrying both bac Boone is lying on the bed. It is unmade. Both Lori and Bo lightly dressed, clothes casually thrown on after an afte lovemaking. Lori: You know what? BOONE: What? LORI: We should get out of Calgary for a few days. Just t BOONE: Anywhere special? LORI: Somewhere we can be alone together. BOONE: More alone than this? LORI: Yeah. Just you and me. No work. No telephone calls. BOONE: Bad dreams. LORI: No bad dreams. BOONE: How did you know? LORI: I know. I always know. It's no big deal. BOONE: I'm going around in some crazy loop in my head. LORI: You're not crazy. BOONE: No. LORI: Say it like you mean it. BOONE: I believe it. I'm not crazy. But I want this damn of my head.  He gets up and goes to the window. BOONE: Decker's started calling me again. LORI: When? BOONE: All last week. Every day. LORI: What does he want? BOONE: I don't know. I haven't called him back. LORI: If he can help, see him. Tell him it's all gone but dreams. BOONE: They're not bad. That's what's weird. The more I h the more I like them. Now I do sound like a crazy, right? LORI: No. You sound like the man I love. A little haunted but the sanest man I ever met. BOONE: Keep going. LORI: Will you see Decker? BOONE: You think I should? LORI: Where's the harm? You tell him from me, I'm the onl should be dreaming about. BOONE: I don't think he'd get it. He never had a wet drea life. LORI: I don't want to be competing with things I can't se Can't share I don't want to be always feeling that someth pulling at you. BOONE: I'm not going anywhere, Lori. Except with you. LORI: I can't hear that often enough. BOONE: I'll never leave you. Not ever. I swear. He kisses her, passionately. BOONE: Can't remember a time when I didn't love you. LORI: How about before we met? BOONE: Even then. They kiss again. We move past them into the darkness outs window. Dissolve to the moon, clearing cloud.

Boone grabs the pills. DECKER [cont.]: I can't tell you how sorry I am...

You s off, you kept them from me! Narcisse paces again, starting to sob and sniffle. Boone NARCISSE [cont.] [barely audible - between cries]: ...Midian...Midian... Boone's eyes open like a shot. BOONE: What did you say? NARCISSE: I said shut up, you want to ruin everything? Boone leaps to his feet, grabs and easily overpowers the BOONE: What did you say, just now? NARCISSE [suddenly friendly]: What did you say, just now? BOONE: You said Midian. NARICSSE [coyly]: Did I? Maybe... BOONE [hurting him - desperate]: What do you know about i NARCISSE: It's where the monsters go. text: Boone's car rolls to a stop. Boone steps out and looks at in the dust. A battered sign. It reads:

There is no sign of life. BOONE: No....oh no...[in despair] No! His shout echos. The wind blows up a cloud of dust around walks through the dust, on the verge of tears. And then.. clears, and he sees...

Necropolis, lying on the other side of a thick expanse of Puzzlement overtakes despair. He squints to see more clea The Necropolis is vast. High walls, surrounded by reeds, tops of mausoleums, showing above it. ALmost a fortressed Boone starts towards it.

The sun is low in the sky, the light golden glinting off The reeds sigh. Boone pushes one of the gates open and st His footsteps echo, unnaturally loud in this city of the either side of him, elegant and elaborate mausoleums, run into the distance, with numerous smalls tombs set around them. The sun finally sinks out of sight. Its final glow dies o of the mausoleums. There are already stars overhead. Boone walks on a little way, as the night sounds begin. E he sits down on a tomb and leans back against the stone. BOONE [softly - a bitter irony]: Dead ... all of the dead He rummages for a cigarette in his jacket pocket. Pulls o Lights it. The flame seems to excite sounds around him. H The walkways are empty in both directions. There's a guttural sound at his back. He stands, drops th cigarette, backs away. From the darkness behind him steps form. A knife is put to his lower belly. Its wielder, Kin massive man, face distorted, his features grotesquely bif KINSKI [whispers]: Move and I gut you. Boone stays still. The growling from between the tombs be VOICE [from the darkness]: You got him? KINSKI: I got him. A reptilian hand reaches out and picks up Boone's dropped BOONE: Midian? Are you from Midian? KINSKI: We should take him below, Peloquin. The silhouette of Peloquin, a were-creature, moves betwee tombs. He draws on the cigarette. By its brightening poin an extraordinary face: more animal than human, but no rec species. PELOQUIN: He's not Nightbreed. He's Natural. BOONE: No! I've killed people, I'm like you, that's why I PELOQUIN: Shut the fuck up. You're meat. KINSKI: If we eat him we break the Law. BOONE: My God...my God, it's true ... PELOQUIN: Of course it's true. Everything's true ... [he emerge from the shadows] God's an astronaut. Oz is over t And Midian's where the monsters live. And you came to die BOONE: I didn't...didn't come to die. I came to be with y of you. Peloquin reaches out and touches Boone's chest. PELOQUIN: No. Sorry. I can smell innocence at fifty yards BOONE: I've killed people. Fifteen people. PELOQUIN: Who told you that? BOONE: What do you mean? PELOQUIN: He lied, asshole. He lied. You're a Natural. An means...you're meat for the Beast. Peloquin growls, throwing his head back and forth with a grace, the image flickering as he does so. Boone watches, the blur of Peloquin's motion he transforms, the tentacle head lengthening and thickening, thrashing around as thou a life of their own. He moves towards Boone, taking hold of him and tearing hi open. KINSKI: We mustn't. It's the Law. They'll exile us... PELOQUIN: Fuck the Law! I want meat! He bites Boone's neck, tearing at his flesh. KINSKI: Peloquin, no! Kinski takes the knife from Boone's belly and pushes Pelo Boone slips away from them. PELOQUIN: Damn you! He races after Boone, who runs blindly, his hand pressed wound on his neck.

DECKER [lowers his voice]: Lieutenant, I can bring him ou listen to me. Joyce ponders, then signals him forward. Decker advances DECKER [cont.]: Boone, it's all right, I've explained eve them. Inquisitors step aside to show torture scenes. We track t tortures: racks, crucifixion, floggings, a hanging. The c off gallows, past a wall to flags. We cut close on the fl reads FREAK SHOW, track past the flag to a cage, containi Breed. Well-dressed ordinary men and women applaud and laugh. One of the freaks is dragged from the cages. He looks bac family he's left behind. The inquisitor reads their charges, as the bonfire awaits The Victim is thrown onto the bonfire. A tinder flares, a inquisitors and audience light cigarettes and cigars from The bonfire then flares up. An inquisitor lasciviously strokes the naked buttocks of girl. She turns towards us in despair; we see her head is

Overwhelmed with horror, Lori opens her eyes, breaking he connection with Babette. RACHEL: We are all that remain. LORI: And...and you're saying...Boone's like you? RACHEL: He is Nightbreed. Or he was, until he broke the L LORI [moving towards the door]: No, no, that's not possib I've got to find him, there's been some kind of mistake.. BABETTE: Don't go... LORI: But he didn't kill anybody, it wasn't him, he's inn RACHEL: That no longer matters... LORI: Where is he? Where'd he go? RACHEL: Down to the Tabernacle, to Baphomet. LORI: Who? RACHEL: The Baptiser. Who made Midian. Who called us here and saved us from our enemies... LORI: Take me there, I've got to find Boone... RACHEL: It's forbidden. LORI: We'll see about that.

Decker is drinking coffee. A cop strides by. Joyce enters JOYCE: Decker? This better be good. DECKER: I found Boone. JOYCE: Someone brought the corpse down here? DECKER: He's not dead. JOYCE: I saw him pumped full of bullets. DECKER: So did I. But he's alive. He killed again... JOYCE: In Shere Neck? DECKER: No, out at Midian. JOYCE: Why'd he go back there? Eigerman enters. EIGERMAN: What are you doing in my office? KANE: This is Inspector Joyce. Calgary Police Department. EIGERMAN: We don't need any city boys on the case. Midian jurisdiction. JOYCE: We can work together. EIGERMAN: No we don't. I'll bring him in myself. This is DECKER: He's not alone anymore. JOYCE: What? EIGERMAN: Yeah. I heard that talk. That's nuthouse talk. JOYCE: Talk about what? DECKER: Midian's not empty. There's something breeding th the cemetery. EIGERMAN: Bullshit. JOYCE [to Decker]: Do you believe that? DECKER: Yes I do. And if you don't stop them there's goin more bloodshed. I promise.

Lori finds herself in a cavernous space, lined with chamb connected by walkways and ladders, which don't look parti secure. She moves out on to a walkway. It leads her into core of Midian, which offers a view of dizzying descent i earth. She scans the scene, amazed by the sheer scale of LORI: My God... As she descends into the bowels of Midian, creatures in v doorways watch her with curiosity. One creature seems to running from wounds on its body. Another tumbles past her acrobat, defying gravity. She sees only a few of these bu more, chattering and murmuring in the shadows.

As Lori moves through the chambers toward Peloquin we see creature Lude feeding snakes to his pet, a horned, many l which squats on the floor. He gets up and goes to look at a grinning grotesque, appears from the back of the chambe the snake from the maw of the pet, and comes to watch as LEROY [eating the snake]: There goes the neighbourhood.
Lori looks into a chamber. A dark, winged figure moves as reveal... A ceremony, with the bowls of white blood later seen in B chamber, is in progress.

As Lori crosses the bridge something watches from the dee shadows...the tone darkens. She steps off the bridge and scuttle away. Lori is now a little nervous. She finds her corner with several doors...Through one door she sees a m white T-shirt. She calls after him. LORI: Boone? Lori enters through the door.

In a corner a ghastly meal is underway. The Boone figure away through another door. Lori follows the figure, and t get up as if to attack. In the next chamber is a tangle o glistening bodies with no heads...Lori glances round. The pursue her.
Up ahead of Lori is the Boone figure. She approaches it a out of the shadows... It is not Boone!! She steps away...

The red beast is rising behind her. Lori turns and exits chamber, flattening herself against the rock. She advance in a niche above where she's walking, we see a small liza creature, Barabas, eating a dead rat.

Lori enters the final chamber, following the figure she t Boone. On the far side, crouching at a door, a figure. LORI: Boone? The figure turns. It's Peloquin. PELOQUIN: No-one here of that name. She turns. The Boone figure is in the doorway behind her. face of a snake. PELOQUIN: Told you! He approaches Lori. PELOQUIN: I know you. He talks about you. Lori. He snatches a broach from her. PELOQUIN: Nice. You're still a Natural. Want to join the goes to bite her] LORI: No! Peloquin follows her to the door. PELOQUIN [at door]: You will. Sooner or later you'll want forever. He laughs maniacally, returning into his room.

Lori continues her descent. As she nears the cavern floor steps into her path, beside him his fool, Ohnaka. LYLESBURG: You may go no further. LORI: I want Boone! LYLESBURG: You're not to blame, but you must understand: Boone's done has put us in jeopardy... LORI: No problem, you tell me where he is and we're outta LYLESBURG: Boone has gone to Baphomet. He is beyond recal A low rumbling issues from somewhere deep inside the pass Lylesburg stands before. Underneath the rumble is an anim moaning with pain. LORI: Where is he? He's down here isn't he? You want to s you're gonna have to kill me. Impressed by her resolve, Lylesburg stands aside. She mov and heads down into the chamber, towards a distant light. gestures after her. Ohnaka nods and follows.

Lori heads through a room which leads towards the Berserk The reassuring sounds of the Core fade behind her. She sl advance. Suddenly, Narcisse steps from the shadows. NARCISSE: Up and about already? LORI: Keep away from me. NARCISSE: I'm sorry about upstairs. I see a pretty face a to kiss it. [Lori moves on past] Don't go down there. LORI: Why not? NARCISSE [instant change of subject]: Don't you just love place? Shangri-La on dope. I love it. LORI: What's that smell? NARCISSE [sniffs his armpits]: Not me. They keep the Bers there. Mad bastards. They'll rip your head off and shit d neck. LORI: Boone went this way, right? NARCISSE: And won't be coming back. LORI: I'll bring him. NARCISSE: You think love can raise the dead? LORI: He's not dead. NARCISSE: He's that and more. If you don't believe me, yo he gets to sniff a little blood. That'll bring out the be I'm telling you, don't go... LORI: I have to. Nothing makes any sense without him. NARCISSE: Sense? Who needs it? Lori moves off down the corridor. Ohnaka follows her. NARCISSE [to Ohnaka]: Love those tattoos.

Lori starts down the corridor, the walls of which are cra in places, the gaps covered with chains. From the other s hears grunts and growls. Then, to her shock, one of the B arms reaches up from a grille in the floor and snatches a She steps aside to avoid it, and another of the Berserker reaches through the mesh of chains, taking hold of her by It starts to choke her. She shouts for help. Ohnaka, Lylesburg's fool, appears from down the corridor. to rattle the chains further along the wall. OHNAKA: Hey, Ghost! Hey, Slaughter! Come and get me! Come and get me! The arm around Lori's neck releases its hold, and we hear of the creatures moving along the walls in Ohnaka's direc OHNAKA: Fat-asses! Suddenly, arms reach for him through the chains. He steps in time. OHNAKA: Missed! He grins at Lori, proud of himself. LORI: Where's Boone? OHNAKA: This way! He starts to lead her towards Baphomet's chamber.

Ohnaka and Lori reach the next to last chamber; a roaring below, down a slope in front of them, walls vibrating wit from Baphomet's chamber. Ohnaka withdraws. Blindingly bri out of which Lori spots a figure climbing towards them. LORI: Boone? Boone! She moves down to Boone, scrambling up the slope towards drenched in sweat, half-mad with terror. BOONE: Don't...don't look... He reaches for her, then collapses. She starts down the s him. Dust falls from the roof, the din makes her reel. Bu reaches him, starts to haul him to his feet. Then, she lo we get a glimpse of...

Out of the blinding light, and seemingly the source of it black figure turns towards her, twelve feet high, severed connected by sinews of hot, white energy and extruded spi face terrible, wise and beautiful. Lori's stunned, she averts her eyes. Boone collects himse to pull her away and they help each other frantically scr slope, out of the chamber.
As Lori and Boone emerge, Ohnaka appears and beckons them Too exhausted and frightened to speak, Boone and Lori follow.

Ominous rumblings urge them on, as Boone and Lori make a ascent through the core, trailing Ohnaka's urgent lead, w the doorways by a variety of creatures. We cut to the led to a chamber, where Peloquin and Shuna Sassi are making l Peloquin hears Lori urging Boone on as they struggle acro bridge, and looks away from Shuna, out through the door. PELOQUIN: Well, well... He goes to the door. PELOQUIN [cont.]: Guess he couldn't take the heat. SHUNA SASSI: I dreamt him. He's strong. PELOQUIN: That's only because the bite was mine. SHUNA SASSI: No, don't you see? He's the one from the pro Cabal. The seventh saviour. PELOQUIN: So why's he leaving? SHUNA SASSI: Everything has its purpose. Maybe he hasn't hate his tribe enough. He'll be back. Peloquin kisses her. PELOQUIN: Why die waiting?

The sun climbs over the horizon, sunlight penetrates the A mausoleum door creaks open, Lori and Boone rush out int air. Lori tries to lead Boone away, he squints painfully early light. BOONE: No, no, I belong here... LORI [grabs him]: Bullshit! Boone, Boone, listen to me - with me, that's why you lived, that's why we survived, because we belong together... Ohnaka swings the door shut behind them. Boone sees Lori, the first time. She takes his hand, presses it to her fac breast. LORI [cont.]: This is me. This is why I followed you, thi we're living for. His eyes clear. A part of him seems to return. He embrace BOONE: Lori... LORI: They don't need you. Nobody needs you but me. We'll far away, where no-one will ever find us. I love you. They hold each other.
Boone and Lori - two small figures, alone among the sepul move towards the gate together.
Empty streets. No activity. Lori's car pulls into the par

Lori turns to Boone, slumped down in the passenger seat, sight, wearing sunglasses. LORI: I'll get my stuff, I'll be back in two minutes... BOONE: Don't leave me alone. LORI: Boone... BOONE [fiercely]: No! LORI [calmly  trying to hide her alarm]: Okay. We'll go i She hands him the Buffalo Days hat and opens the door.
From a phone booth across the street we see Lori and Boon towards the motel entrance. In foreground, a chain-mailed up the phone and dials.

Boone and Lori enter the corridor that leads to her room. silence, save for a dog yapping somewhere. Boone stops. A turns to him. LORI [whispers]: What's wrong? BOONE: Why is it so empty? LORI: They must be at the rodeo. She hurries on, Boone follows, clearly disturbed. Lori un door, glancing back at Boone, who has taken off his sungl is something strange about the light in his eyes. A subtl colour passes across his face. BOONE: I smell blood. LORI: What? BOONE: So much blood... She swings the door open. We expect a horror. Nothing. An room. LORI: It's okay.

Lori enters and quickly gathers her belongings together. Boone, sweating with terror, slides down the wall into a position. As Lori packs, she looks down, sees a hole in the wall, t of some massive violence from the other side. She cautiou down, peers through the hole and quickly retreats, hand o horrified by what she's seen. LORI: Boone? Boone appears at the door. LORI[cont.]: Next door. Boone goes next door and turns the handle.

Boone pushes the door open. Inside, a massacre: five dead players, propped up around a poker table in a sick parody game tableau; throats slit, Buffalo Hats on their heads. the middle of the table, a tall, elaborate house of cards Boone moves into the middle of the room. On his face we c hunger he feels. Ripples of color begin to move over his moves towards the corpses...as he does so, we hear a near sound from outside...the vibrations knock over the house and...

Into the empty street, a helicopter descends, discharging Joyce and a platoon of heavily armed Swat Team cops. Loca cars pour in. Captain Eigerman climbs out of his cruiser to survey the Decker introduces him to Joyce. Sharpshooters take up pos training their weapons on the motel, as the Swat Team mov

Lori moves to the door of the murder room. Boone is insid to her. LORI: It was Decker...Decker did this... In foreground, Boone's face begins to transform, which Lo see. She hears the cops outside. LORI [cont.]: Boone, we have to get out of here. BOONE: Stay away from me... LORI: Boone, what is it? BOONE: I don't want you to see... LORI: See what? BOONE: Get out! Do as I say! LORI: I won't leave you... As she crosses towards him, he turns. His face is in mid- transformation.
Lori's scream echoes outside the motel. Joyce orders in t Team. They charge, entering the motel.
Lori backs out of the room in horror. LORI: Oh my God...oh my God... She hears cops charging up the stairs. LORI [cont.]: Boone! They're coming!

The transformed Boone covers his face, slams the room doo moves towards the bodies. Lori hides at the end of the corridor as the Swat cops ap far end. On his knees, in the middle of some frenzied action we ca see, Boone stops and looks down at his blood-stained hand BOONE: No...No... Out of sight, Lori watches the cops prepare to storm the

Boone enters the bathroom with the sound of the Swat Team the motel on the track. He slams the door. There is blood and hands. He goes to the sink and turns on the tap. Then himself in the mirror, his transformed face is a shock, H himself, appalled. Then a wave of nausea overtakes him. H into the sink; a splash of blood and flesh he's just eate his mouth with the back of his hands he starts to breathe condition. His face transforms back to his normal state. sob of horror. SWAT LEADER (V.O.): In here! Boone looks towards the door, sinking down against the ti does so. The door is flung open. We see him cowering as t come for him.

Under cover of the trees and cars around the motel, Lori place where she can view the front of the building. She sees Eigerman talking with Joyce, Decker behind them. up as the Swat cops manhandle a hand-cuffed Boone out of building. He has totally reverted to human form, the bloo seemingly a sure proof of guilt. Lori watches as he's thr police car and driven off.

head_text.subj: INT. SHERE NECK POLICE STATION DAY

text: A clank of keys opening locks. A steel door swings open. rough-house Boone down the corridor, Eigerman right behin other cells holding prisoners watching them go by. We hol young fundamentalist Baptist preacher, Reverend Ashberry. haunted, maniacally repressed eyes and the ragged look of drunk.

Boone is thrown into the cell. Eigerman and the three cop Labowitz, Sergeant Pettine and Gibbs, all practised hard the cell after him. EIGERMAN: Fuckin' freak! Fuckin' cannibal! [to his men] S They haul Boone to his feet. Eigerman hits Boone with a w blackjack. EIGERMAN [cont.]: You picked the wrong town, boy. We beli justice here, [a blow is delivered] They're gonna take yo the city...[another blow]...but we're gonna leave you with something...[another blow]...to remember...[another] Boone sags to the ground, unconscious.

As the sound of Boone being beaten up filters through the Ashberry sits in his cell, Bible in hand. He flicks the p attempting to distance himself from the violence he hears He halts at a page with an illustration. It is something Revelations: monsters and demons doing battle with angels the book down, and turns over his palm. It is a mass of t He closes his hand into a white-knuckled fist, retreating shadows in the corner of his cell. We cutback to his hand. Blood seeps between the fingers, nails dig into the meat of his palm.

Eigerman enters. Decker is standing looking at Eigerman's of photographs. EIGERMAN: You still here? DECKER: I'm going back to Midian with you. EIGERMAN: I'm not going anywhere. We got press folks and photographers coming in from all over. Wouldn't be polite waiting. Eigerman starts to exit again. Joyce is in the doorway. EIGERMAN: Tell him. We got our man under lock and key. DECKER: Don't trust him. He...he...changes. I've seen him EIGERMAN: I'll keep an eye out. JOYCE: He was right about the motel. EIGERMAN: So? JOYCE: So maybe there are more of them... EIGERMAN: Monsters? JOYCE: Killers. A cult. I don't know. EIGERMAN: You want to take some of the boys, take 'em Pet PETTINE: Yes, Sir - EIGERMAN: You, Tommy and Gibbs, take the Inspector out to cemetery. Dig around. If you find anything with more two holler. I got photographers wanting me... He exits.

Badly beaten, Boone lies in the corner, stirring when he door unlocked. Labowitz ushers in a middle-aged, small-to physician, Doctor Rose. LABOWITZ: Doctor's here to examine you, freak. Just so no say we laid a finger on you...[he winks at Rose] Looks ok what do you think, Doc? Boone painfully pulls himself upright. Looks up at Dr Ros slips on his stethoscope, listens to Boone's chest. He mo listens, moves it again, alarmed. He takes Boone's wrist, around. Boone stares at him. Dr Rose clears his throat, r to Labowitz at the door and speaks quietly. DR ROSE: No pulse. LABOWITZ: What's that? DR ROSE: No...pulse.

A crowd of journalists and on-lookers mill outside the st find Lori, following her through the crowd as she tries t of the building. As she watches, Joyce and his three-cop escort climb into cars and drive off.

An impromptu press conference, with Eigerman centre stage at a table laced with tape recorders and microphones. Behind him, a map of the town, with coloured pins and a b drawing of the Sweetgrass Inn, including a diagram of whe bodies were found. Eigerman adores the attention. EIGERMAN: Yes he may have had accomplices but I can't rev precise source of my information on that... 1ST REPORTER: Local source, Captain? EIGERMAN [a glance at Decker in the crowd]: Not so's you' 2ND REPORTER: Has Boone made a confession? EIGERMAN: We found him with a piece of human flesh in his How's that for guilty? Cameras flash furiously. We see Labowitz leading Dr Rose crowd to the podium. Labowitz reaches Eigerman and whispe ear. Eigerman makes him repeat it. His brow knits in puzz turns to the press and smiles. EIGERMAN [cont.]: 'Scuse me, folks, won't be a second. Eigerman points a beckoning finger at Decker, who follows his office, along with Labowitz and Dr Rose.

Eigerman closes the door and turns to Decker. EIGERMAN: Just exactly how many bullets did they put into up at Midian? DECKER: Why? DR ROSE [severely shaken]: Half of them are still in him. he's riddled with them. DECKER: As I told you, these aren't ordinary people. You' he should be dead? DR ROSE: No, I'm saying he is dead. DECKER: When? EIGERMAN: Not lying down dead, friend. Walkin' around in cell dead. Now what about that? Decker's shaken. He grips his briefcase tightly.
Boone sits in his cell, head down, expression masked, eye restlessly.

Ashberry is sitting half in shadow and half in light. His the half-buried mania that we'll see erupt later on. He p against the wall and speaks softly to Boone, his tone int his feelings take stronger hold. ASHBERRY: Can you hear me? They'll find a way to kill you that? Can't fight the darkness. Not when it's inside you. Are you listening? You're an abomination, Boone. You die. There's lots of ways. I've read about them. Seen the sleep. Horrible. HEAR ME? He suddenly slams his bloody hand against the wall. ASHBERRY: Have you got a God, Boone? Any God'll do. I had but...he doesn't listen any more. I ask him to take the dreams away but they keep coming. Blood and fire. Like th the world... We move from Ashberry's stricken face to the bloody mark left in the wall. It vaguely resembles something we recog Baphomet's head.

Lori emerges from a supermarket with food to eat. She wal small square, finds a seat and sits down to eat. As she r the bag: BABETTE[V.O.]:Lori? She looks round. The voice sounded real. No sign of Babet BABETTE [V.O. - cont.]: Lori...close your eyes. LORI [frightened]: Where are you? BABETTE [V.O.]: Please, do as I say. Lori closes her eyes.

Lori and Babette's P.O.V. - darkness. BABETTE [V.O.]: Be with me...be with me... Dim light. We're in the Midian skull chamber, seeing it t Babette's eyes. Their voices merge into one. LORI/BABETTE [V.O.]: ...where am I? What's happening to m Rachel steps into view, and looks directly down at the ca RACHEL: What is it, child?
Lori's eyes spring open. She's terrified. BABETTE [V.O.]: Lori! Comeback! Lori closes her eyes again and we click back into...

Lori and Babette's P.O.V. - we see Babette's view of Rach LORI/BABETTE [V.O.]: Is this real? RACHEL [whispers]: What are you talking about? Babette? [ Babette] What have you done? LORI/BABETTE [V.O.]: I've brought her, to see. She's in m breaks away, Rachel tries to catch hold, Babette runs. P.O.V. camera veers around and down through the maze of M
Eyes closed on the bench, Lori gasps as the journey snatc

Lori and Babette's P.O.V. - Babette races over a rope-bri it all through her eyes, her hands coming occasionally in head down a narrow tunnel and into a small chamber, which Babette's hidehole. We scan the treasures she keeps there made of grasses; birds' skulls; pretty stones. We hear vo above and we look up at a steel grille, facing out on the

Pushing closer to the grille we see...Joyce, Pettine, Tom Gibbs, wandering through the Necropolis, armed to the hil Joyce carries no weapon. PETTINE: Christ, you could hide a fuckin' army in here. TOMMY: What egg-zactly are we lookin' for, Sarge? TOMMY [spits some tobacco juice on a tomb]: We're here to major-league butt. JOYCE [distrusts these throwbacks]: We're here to scout, TOMMY: Well what if they engage us? What about that? PETTINE: There's people down there, I can feel it. Lori/Babette gasps, Pettine hears the sound and walks ove grille. TOMMY: Why don't we just shoot 'em in their graves? Save diggin' new ones, [giggles - fires at one of the tombs] JOYCE [angry]: Hold your fire! PETTINE: We want prisoners, Tommy. Pettine goes down on his haunches beside the grille, runs of his gun along it. P.O.V. camera withdraws into the shadows. He shakes his head and...

We cut out of the P.O.V. as Pettine stands. PETTINE: There's something down there all right. JOYCE: If that's the case we'll call for back-up... Pettine spots a movement in the shadows of a half-open ma door. He catches Gibbs' eye, nods in the direction of the gets the idea and starts to back towards the tomb. PETTINE [a performance]: I don't know. Maybe we're just s Hell, who'd live in a graveyard, anyway? [crossing toward What do you say, Lieutenant? Maybe we oughta just pack it for home... He and Gibbs rush the door of the tomb; there's a cry of from inside.

Lori and Babette's P.O.V. - Camera glides back up to the time to see Gibbs and Pettine drag Ohnaka out of darkness the sunlight where he lacks the strength to resist. TOMMY: Well, lookee what we got here... Tommy strikes Ohnaka with a rifle butt, knocking him to h

As the cops circle around Ohnaka, he moans, puts his head covers his face with his hands. GIBBS: Shit. Don't look so tough to me. PETTINE: Want we should interrogate it, Lieutenant? JOYCE [amazed]: Give it some room. In the sunlight, Ohnaka's naked back begins to smoke and GIBBS: What the hell for? JOYCE: God damn it! There's something wrong with him... TOMMY [disgusted]: Shit... PETTINE: What the fuck is this? Gibbs, unfazed, steps up to Ohnaka and kicks the creature GIBBS: We want answers, asshole! JOYCE: Back off, Gibbs! Gibbs ignores him, trying to drag Ohnaka's hands away fro
Lori and Babette's P.O.V. - Watching the knot of men arou defenceless Ohnaka. LORI/BABETTE [V.O.]: The light...

Gibbs rifle-butts Ohnaka's hands, then pulls them away fr face; the features are horribly disfigured, blood running eyes, scorched by the sun. Now even Gibbs tries to back a Ohnaka grabs hold of his shirt. GIBBS: Shit! Shit! Get it off me! Tommy! TOMMY: No way, man! Pettine fires his piece at Ohnaka, hitting him in the bel but he still holds on, throwing back his head and howling rises from his entire body, dust pours from his veins. Th becomes a high-pitched whine and he explodes, in a burst black blood.
Lori and Babette's P.O.V. - They see Ohnaka die.
Lori opens her eyes, which are running with tears. LORI: Oh my God...oh my God... She stands up, her hand to her mouth.
Lori and Babette's P.O.V. - Babette's trembling hands hol grille as she watches. BABETTE [V.O.]: Lori, don't leave, please don't leave me.

The cops stare in disbelief at Ohnaka's dusty remains. PETTINE: Jesus...d'you see that fucker's face? JOYCE: It was the sun. The sun did it. GIBBS: Christ on a crutch... JOYCE: Man, that tears it, I'm calling the fuckin' chief. Gibbs raises a trembling match to his cigarette as Tommy to the cars. GIBBS: Couldn't have been just...just the sun... JOYCE: Believe it, shithead. PETTINE [grinning]: So if all it takes is the sun, we got perfect weapon, right over our heads. JOYCE: Until it goes down. Pettine's smile fades. Then a cry of alarm from the dista TOMMY [V.O.]: Oh no! Shit! Pettine! Goddamn it! The men rush to the gate.

The two police cars are on fire. The other cops reach the reaches into the one less involved in flame and pulls out microphone. JOYCE: Who did it, did you see anyone?  Tommy shakes his head. They all look up, hearing a distan

Wearing a hat and dark glasses, laughing, Narcisse drives clunker like a maniac, takes a large cigar out of his mou He strikes a match off a thumb hook and lights up. In the protected from sunlight by shades on the windows, is Rach

The door opens, a panicked Labowitz enters. LABOWITZ: Chief, come quick... EIGERMAN [from inside a stall]: This better be good... LABOWITZ: Pettine's on the radio, they're under attack. EIGERMAN: Hot damn, we got contact! He bursts out of the stall, hitching his trousers.
Eigerman enters, takes the two-way receiver. Behind him, Labowitz and Kane enter the office. EIGERMAN: Pettine, what's your situation.

Pettine on the radio, as the others try to keep back the PETTINE [into radio]: The place is crawling with 'em...th our cars...fuckin' freaks!... The transmission breaks up. Eigerman turns to the others EIGERMAN [joyfully]: ...Sound the call, boys, let the bel freedom ring, we got to mobilize. Decker affectionately runs his hand over his briefcase.

Lori moves down the street, blinking through tears. BABETTE [V.O.]: I'm afraid ... LORI: I have to go, Babette, I have to get help. I'll be promise. You hide somewhere. The connection fades. Lori wipes the tears from her cheek

The crowd and journalists still hanging around; Eigerman door open. EIGERMAN: Listen up! We got officers under attack, I need for a posse! Y'all sign up with Officer Labowitz here! He moves back towards the office, as Labowitz, clipboard besieged with offers.
Decker is sitting with his briefcase open on his lap, gaz

at the button head mask inside. He snaps the case shut as re-enters, followed by the silent Kane. Eigerman digs a k out of his desk. EIGERMAN: If you're gonna make an omelette you have to br isn't that right, Professor? DECKER [doesn't follow]: Sorry? EIGERMAN: Christmas comes early this year.

head_text.subj: INT. POLICE STATION STORAGE ROOM DAY

text: Eigerman leads Decker, Kane and another cop down into the the station. He unlocks a door and switches on a light. W inside is a virtual arsenal in a number of packing crates with a martial insignia and the name:

The crates are also stamped with their countries of origi Africa and the Soviet Union. EIGERMAN: Ounce a' prevention is worth a pound a' cure. S rainy day, one day that day will come. Don't matter if it homos, freaks or Japs, we are ready. World class ordnance best private sector money can buy. Kane, with a clipboard, goes over supplies with the other KANE [over above  in his element): Okay. We got your span G3 thirty-odd-six Springfield semi-auto with roller-lock action and retractable stock. For standard carbine firepo can't beat this match-accurate Galil AR 7.62 NATO assault for the sportsman in the crowd we carry this handy, doubl Mossberg Persuader, sling swivels double extractors, whic in a light-weight single-barrel size for ladies and junio DECKER: Marvelous, really, but - KANE: Now over here we're talkin' Damascus, high-carbon S shootin' knives, and for that tough up-close-and- personal work, you can always count on your razor-wire/fi garotte when nuthin' else will do  DECKER [over Kane]: Captain, have you considered the poss that knives and bullets won't be adequate to the task? EIGERMAN: Show him, Kane. KANE [pulling off a shroud to unveil]: That's why we boug cherry Israeli Army high-octane linear-field flame throwe EIGERMAN: Now I know what you're thinkin', Doc; maybe the sort'a spiritual angle to all this. Well, we got that covered, too.

A cell door swings open. Decker and Eigerman look in on t preacher, Reverend Ashberry. EIGERMAN: Reverend Ashberry, your services are required. DECKER: He looks like a drunk. EIGERMAN: He is; lost his way, poor bastard, [hauling Ash his feet] You wouldn't wanna miss the Day of Judgment, no ASHBERRY [seems he's been waiting for this]: The Apocalyp here? EIGERMAN: They're warming up for it over in Midian. [lead out] Padre, you get your pious butt over to church and lo some Holy Water and crucifixes...we're goin' in there wit side.

Boone looks out the window of his cell as a large, unruly musters outside in a variety of vehicles. A mix of surviv fanatics in Sons of the Free-labelled camouflage, Marlbor six-shooters, red-neck bozos with their diesel-dyke mamas made-up bimbos out for a good time. The atmosphere is one carnival. Accoutred for combat, Kane and some other cops distribute Boone slumps away from the window, his worst fears realiz Reverend Ashberry arrives, lugging six full canteens and of crucifixes. He loads into the back of an enclosed, hig camper with Eigerman and Decker. Eigerman blows an air-ho the crowd's attention. EIGERMAN: You are all hereby deputized in the name of the let's kick some ass! Eigerman's truck leads the caravan, which drives off, hor war whoops and liquor-fuelled courage. As the dust clears more or less alone, Lori looks at the police station. A beat-up car squeals to a halt in front of her and the f opens. NARCISSE: Hey, chickie, want a ride? LORI: No... RACHEL: Please. Lori sees Rachel and gets in the car.

Narcisse drives around the block, smoking his cigar. NARCISSE: We have to get Boone out, Midian needs him... LORI: What could he do? RACHEL: He went into Baphomet's chamber. He spoke with th NARCISSE: And survived; nobody ever did that before. RACHEL: Perhaps Baphomet told him something, something th save Midian. NARCISSE: Where they keeping him? LORI: Inside somewhere. He'll be guarded. RACHEL: He has powers of his own. LORI: Tell me about it; what's happened to him? NARCISSE: He was bitten by a Nightbreed, see, the taint's system... RACHEL: Boone has been turned, he's one of us... LORI: Okay. So what you're saying is, you're saying he's NARCISSE: Hey, some of my best friends are dead. LORI [horrified]: ...I'm going out of my mind. NARCISSE [to Rachel]: See? I told you she'd take it well.
The posse heads down the road, whoops and hollers emergin dust cloud it kicks up.

head_text.subj: INT. CAB OF EIGERMAN'S TRUCK DAY

text: Eigerman cleans his silver-plate Magnum .45, Decker sits holding his briefcase, across from Ashberry, who's franti through an ancient Bible. EIGERMAN: Ever performed an exorcism, Father? ASHBERRY: No. EIGERMAN: Ever seen one? ASHBERRY: No. EIGERMAN: Well I'd start rehearsin' if I was you. [hands towards Decker] Why don't you hang on to that, Doc? DECKER [a little prim]: Oh no, I wouldn't know how to use ASHBERRY [finds something in the book, reads]: Listen! 'S spoke to the people, saying "Arm yourselves for war and l and take vengeance for the Lord on Midian..." and so they fire all the cities where they dwelt and killed the kings of Midian, both man and beast!' EIGERMAN [with a wink]: Hey, how 'bout that, Doc? Sounds on a crusade against the Devil himself. ASHBERRY [not terribly convincing]: I don't believe in th DECKER: Oh...you will. Ashberry looks at Decker; no trace of irony in his expres Ashberry sorts through the canteens, finds the one that d a white cross on it, opens it and knocks back two fingers

head_text.subj: EXT. SHERE NECK POLICE STATION DAY

text: The sun sinking low in the sky. The shadows are long.

head_text.subj: INT. POLICE STATION CELL CORRIDOR DAY

text: The station is eerily quiet. Labowitz and an Irish cop, C Cormack, guard the cells. Two other cops patrol the end o corridor. All heavily armed. Labowitz moves to the door o cell.

The spy-hole cover is open. Boone looks up. LABOWITZ [from other side of door]: Hey, freak-face, we f pals. They're gonna fry, just like you. Give us a smile n Boone stares at the floor, depressed, defeated.

Labowitz chuckles and closes the spy-hole. He walks back coffee station near Eigerman's office, where Cormack is p cups. He takes out a flask, spikes his mug and offers som Labowitz. CORMACK: Little Irish in your joe, Constable Labowitz? LABOWITZ [a bad brogue]: Don't mind if I do, Constable Co There is a knock on the station door. They look at each o Cormack picks up his gun and crosses to the door. CORMACK: Who's there? RACHEL [O.S.]: Help me, please. CORMACK: What's wrong? RACHEL [O.S.]: Accident. We need help. Cormack decides to unbolt the door. On the step stands Ra shrouded in black veils. Only her eyes are visible. They Cormack. CORMACK: What's the problem, lady? She drops the veil. The other half of her face has disapp smoke. CORMACK [cont.]: What the blazes? Her costume falls to the ground. Her eyes dissolve. As sm blows into the station. Cormack fires through the smoke, he does so. LABOWITZ [running towards the cell]: Hold 'em, Connie!

The two other cops hear the shot and run towards the stat Labowitz runs back in with them before they get there, sl bolts the door. LABOWITZ [to the other cops]: Hold your ground! [yells th door] Cormack? You all right?

Cormack turns back towards the door, sees Narcisse, screa fires twice. Narcisse flips one of the bullets out of his a thumb-nail, then leaps onto Cormack, who manages to sho in the foot. Lori enters, slams the door and locks it. Na squats over Cormack, holds his razor-nails under his chin NARCISSE: Where is he? Where's Boone? CORMACK: Cell f-f-f-five...through the door... NARCISSE [grins at Lori]: I love a coward.

Labowitz and the other cops confidently prepare for a sie LABOWITZ [calling back to Boone]: Don't think you're gett freak. No way they get through that door; solid steel, armour-piercing shells wouldn't even make a dent... Smoke seeps through the key-hole, and from beneath the co door. LABOWITZ [cont.]: You hear me, freak? No fuckin' way! The smoke from the key-hole begins to form into a face, w on a cord of smoke/flesh from the key-hole. The smoke fro the door forms into breasts and rib cage, in which a hear Labowitz turns and sees it. LABOWITZ [cont.]: Jesus Christ... He empties his gun through the smoke; the two cops on the of the smoke are hit and go down. An arm moves towards Labowitz; so does Rachel's face. Her mesmerizes him. Her naked breasts, which float beneath the head, barely connected to it as yet, enchant him even RACHEL: Come closer...I don't want to kill you... Her hand presses Labowitz's rifle aside. Rachel's lips to doesn't resist, but once his mouth is sealed against hers breathe. He tries to raise the rifle, but she dashes it f hand. Then she snatches the keys from his belt and breaks He falls to his knees, gasping. Her body completed and na unlocks the connecting door, then starts looking for Boon her, as Labowitz reaches for his gun, Narcisse's hand rea grabs his throat. NARCISSE: Naughty, naughty. Labowitz looks up into Narcisse's scarred face and faints steps past Labowitz to the cell Rachel directs her toward RACHEL: We don't have much time. LORI: I know. Lori unlocks the door.

LORI [nervous]: Boone? BOONE [wakes]: Stay away from me. I'll hurt you. LORI: I don't think so. BOONE: You know what I did in that room? I'm a goddamn ca Stay away! LORI: They're going to come for you. BOONE: Let them. Let them find some way to kill me. LORI: You can't die. Midian needs you. BOONE: Midian's just a hole in the ground. It's full of t should lie down and stay dead. LORI: All right. If not for the Breed, then for me. You c up on us. BOONE: You talk like you're one of them. LORI: Maybe I wish I was. Some little part of me. [she pu on his face] All I know is, I'm not afraid of you. I know be, but I'm not. I still want you, whatever you are. And going to leave you. If they come for you, then they'll ha me too. BOONE: No! LORI: So fight. For both of us. For all of us. I don't wa dust. I want us flesh and blood. Kiss me. I love you. He kisses her. First tentatively, then with great passion
Narcisse knocks, calls through the door. NARCISSE: What the hell are you doing in there?
Fucking, is the answer. They are wound around each other: biting, gasping. Boone thrusts up into her. LORI: Yes...yes! NARCISSE [to himself]: Jesus. Bastard does better dead th alive.

The connecting door flies open, a rejuvenated Boone and L into the office where Narcisse and Rachel are waiting. Na with the unconscious Cormack. RACHEL: Are we going? NARCISSE: About time. BOONE: Midian. NARCISSE: All right. BOONE: It's about time they saw the truth.

Gibbs, Joyce, Tommy and Pettine wait outside the gates. P paces. Joyce looks at his watch, moves over to Pettine an quietly. JOYCE: How long until dark? PETTINE: Two hours. Two and a half. I told 'em to bring g We'll burn the bastards out. JOYCE: Has it occurred to you maybe we've got this all wr could be destroying...I don't know, a whole new species. PETTINE: You saw that fucker below, Lieutenant, same as m damn thing was just too weird to live. JOYCE: Maybe they're just different. PETTINE: Isn't that enough reason? Joyce stares at him. In background, Tommy starts to holle calls. PETTINE [cont.]: What is it? Tommy is pointing frantically at a dust cloud in the dist

head_text.subj: EXT. ROAD TO MIDIAN LATE AFTERNOON

text: A violent cut to the roar of engines as we track with the moving posse. Eigerman stands up out of a skylight in the truck, eggs on the other vehicles with a rebel war cry. EIGERMAN: Yee-hah!
As the caravan appears. Ecstasy. Tommy and Gibbs dance a GIBBS: It's the fuckin' cavalry! The posse speeds down towards the Necropolis gates.

Narcisse's beat-up car speeds down the highway towards Mi BOONE: How much further? NARCISSE: A mile, maybe two... We close in on Rachel, who stares ahead of her, as if in RACHEL: We're too late. NARCISSE: Hang on! Steering hard, he veers the car off the road and into thi Branches thrash against the windshield. NARCISSE [cont.]: This is a shortcut!

The posse is busily at work around the Necropolis, Eigerm supervising. Some are laying trails of gasoline through t Others are simply patrolling, guns in hand. There is an a nervous anticipation. Ashberry comes round a tomb and we follow him down a walk staring in awe at the mausoleums and statuary. Looking at a particularly large tomb, Ashberry's eye is c by a large, fantastically rendered marble winged angel. H it, reaches up to touch it. The angel, a monster, turns t him with sad, impassive gravity. Then we see its shadow o face and hear the slow, thick beating of its wings as it Ashberry's stunned. He fumbles the top of his bourbon can takes a long drink, then stops when he sees a load of dyn to the side of the tomb. He follows the wire that leads o another dynamite pack on an adjacent tomb and then anothe panicked.

Kane is escorting Eigerman and Pettine down a pathway, po the posse's handiwork. KANE: ...packets of plastique at every intersection, trip outside the biggest tombs, we figure those'll be the majo routes... EIGERMAN: How much longer? KANE: Five minutes. EIGERMAN [into walkie-talkie]: Let's pull back to the per before we lose the light. We've got movement underground; they're hearing it round the walls. ASHBERRY [approaching them from the side]: Captain! KANE: Jesus, not there, STOP. [Ashberry freezes] We got C planted in the rosebushes, Reverend, cut your nuts off  faster'n a hedge clipper. ASHBERRY: We've made a mistake, there are Angels here, a host... EIGERMAN: You're drunk, asshole. Ashberry dumps the bourbon out of his canteen. ASHBERRY: No. Listen to me, it's wrong, it's sacrilege, t ground... EIGERMAN: Get the hell up that hill, you pinhead. ASHBERRY: You brought me here because I'm a man of God. EIGERMAN: That's right; hang round here a couple more min Padre, and you'll be sitting at his left hand. Now get yo out of the fuckin' way... Eigerman backhands him. Ashberry falls. Eigerman, Kane, P the other cops begin to pull back. Ashberry looks up, as he hears grindings and growls in th Boone is lifting off the top of a nearby tomb. Ashberry i shoot when Narcisse grabs him around the throat, puts a f lips and signals him to be quiet. Narcisse follows Boone tomb. The tomb-lid scrapes as it's pushed back into place beneath. Ashberry starts to pray.

Boone and Narcisse move through the panicking underground fleeing in every direction. Boone sees Lylesburg, trying panic down, moves towards him. LYLESBURG: Stay down! Stay where you are, they're waiting above... BOONE [intercepting him]: No! if you stay here you'll be slaughtered... LYLESBURG: This is our home. BOONE: Not anymore... LYLESBURG: We belong here... BOONE: Listen to me, old man, the rules change; if you wa it won't be here and it won't be by your laws... Other creatures have stopped, watching the confrontation. speaks to them as well. BOONE [cont.]: If you'want to survive we've got to fight can't hide anymore! [to Lylesburg] What's it gonna be? Lylesburg slumps, acquiescing, unable to refuse Boone's a BOONE [cont.] [to Narcisse]: Get the children above groun hiding place...[to the others] Get ready to fight! [to Ly What about Baphomet? Can he be moved? LYLESBURG: Yes. It could be done. BOONE: It must be done. Brothers and sisters, it's time t

Leroy and Lude listen to Boone on the bridge. LEROY: You hear what he said? LUDE: What chance have we got? They're armed. LEROY [opens jacket]: So am I. Two one-eyed snakes, nesting in Leroy's belly, slide up f innards and wrap around his neck. LEROY: They call us monsters, remember? They're afraid of give 'em reason. LUDE: It's a long time since I spilled blood. LEROY: You never lose the knack.

head_text.subj: EXT. HILL ABOVE THE NECROPOLIS DUSK

text: From this high vantage point, Decker watches the preparat through binoculars, with the glee of a pyromaniac at a fi The sun is setting. He stares up at it, squinting into it THE MASK [V.O.]: ...I'm waiting...Philip?... Decker looks towards the patrol car parked nearby. The fr open. On the passenger seat sits his briefcase. Decker qu crosses to the car. DECKER: Be quiet. THE MASK [V.O.]: Let me out, Philip. There's going to be I want to see. Decker opens the briefcase. The mask and his knives are l inside. THE MASK: Ah, that's better. DECKER: We can't let anyone see us... THE MASK: I want to be free! JOYCE [V.O.]: Decker? Decker swings round, slamming the case shut, as Joyce app DECKER: Lieutenant...[covering flawlessly] You gave me su JOYCE: Eigerman's invited you to watch from the command p DECKER: Oh, I don't think I'm up to it, really. JOYCE: ...I've got a bad feeling about this. DECKER: Believe me, Lieutenant, whoever or whatever's liv there deserves what's coming. JOYCE: Monsters, you mean? DECKER: Unnatural, misbegotten creatures. JOYCE: I don't know. The only monsters I've ever seen had face. As Joyce looks down at the Necropolis, Decker sneaks an a long glance at his briefcase.

The final explosives-layers exit, their backs covered by flamethrower and machine-gun-carrying mob members. A dist Ashberry is the last out. Midian is now completely deserted. Dandelion seeds drift walkways, caught in shafts of sunlight.

Eigerman, Pettine and Kane, looking at their watches. KANE [a pause  then]: ...T-minus fifteen seconds...ten, n seven, six, five, four, three, two, one ... EIGERMAN: Go. Kane depresses the detonator. There are two large explosi followed by several smaller ones. Part of the Necropolis blasted out. Several members of the posse retreat. Eigerm pistol. EIGERMAN [cont.]: You there, stand your ground! [fires a shot] Stand your ground, damn you! The defectors stop. Several more chain explosions in Necr

Narcisse is leading a group of child monsters, as the exp bring earth plunging down from the ceiling. Babies cry. M scream. We see several creatures howling in bestial terro Babette is separated from Narcisse's group by falling ear trampled in the chaos. She is picked up by the dog-faced BABETTE: I want my mother. MAN: We'll find her.

Peloquin squats on the step overlooking the fire-pit, lis the sound of invasion from above. There is a mixture of f on his face. In the darkness opposite, Kinski. KINSKI: We began this. PELOQUIN: I just wanted meat. I didn't know he was going this. KINSKI: There were prophesies. The seventh saviour. PELOQUIN: I didn't believe the prophesies and I didn't ob You want to see me bleed for it? All right, I'll bleed. He exits the chamber.

Smoke billows over the walls. Eigerman moves closer to th listening to the wild cries from inside. He grabs Ashberr collar. EIGERMAN: That sound like a heavenly choir to you, Padre? ASHBERRY: I have to see! Ashberry shakes himself free and heads through the gates, Necropolis. Eigerman turns to the others, lights a cigar. EIGERMAN: Pettine! PETTINE: Chief? EIGERMAN: We're moving in. PETTINE [locks and loads his machine-gun]: Yes, sir! [tur addresses the posse] We're movin' in! Car engines are revved, headlights turned on, piercing th

Ashberry wanders through the Necropolis as the Breed begi on every side. The air is full of sad, melodious sounds, like whale-song forms appear from the smoke and drift towards him. ASHBERRY [in awe]: Dear Lord... Some of the creatures brush him as they drift by: their s beauty entrances him. ASHBERRY: Dear Lord ...Forgive me... There are images here which have the flavour of Christian iconography. Mother and child. A man bleeding from his br creature with a halo of smoke. He wanders on.

Decker watches impassively. Joyce moves towards the gate. reaches it an extraordinary creature appears. JOYCE: My God. It means no harm. Joyce steps aside and the creature move the night. We cut back to Decker. THE MASK [V.O.]: Don't deny me Philip... DECKER: Soon. I promise. Decker hears shouts to his flank, steps back, out of sigh Lori and Rachel emerge from a hiding place, Lori trying t Rachel from going in. RACHEL: Babette! LORI: Rachel, no! Rachel breaks away and runs towards the Necropolis. Lori THE MASK [V.O.]: Now, perfect, finish her. She's the only knows about us. DECKER: What about Boone? THE MASK [V.O.]: Boone's a monster. They all die tonight. DECKER [smiles]: All right. THE MASK [V.O.]: Quickly, Philip, we'll lose her. The briefcase is opened. The light of distant fires flick mask.

Boone and Narcisse lead the column of Breed, children and from underground into the Necropolis itself. BOONE: Hurry up. NARCISSE: Is this wise? Coming above ground? BOONE: If we stay below they'll slaughter us. NARCISSE: This is their territory. BOONE: No. The night's ours. Now get the rest of the chil here, I'm going to find a clear way through! He heads away, leaving a frightened group of Breed and ch
Peloquin appears overground, scanning the destruction bef off.

Eigerman addresses the assembled posse. EIGERMAN: They're coming out, and they're armed, so watch yourselves. It's a fucking freak-show in there! We're not prisoners! It's us or them! Let's clean up! The engines rev, and the posse charges the gates. The lea driven by a manic, grinning Kane, rams the gates, and cra KANE: Us or them! Us or them! On the other side of the gates, Peloquin appears in Kane' KANE: Shit! Peloquin jumps up into the air as the car careers towards We see him somersault in the air. Kane hears him land on roof. We see Peloquin on the roof, bend over the windshie His face appears in front of a panicking Kane, the mouth opening grotesquely wide. Kane slams the breaks on. Peloquin is thrown off. KANE: Eat dirt, fucker! Peloquin is thrown to the ground, his face caught in the headlights as Kane's vehicle revs and drives at him. KANE [ecstatic]: Yeah! His momentum carries the car towards the crater blown in Kane's pleasure turns to horror. KANE: Oh shit! Shit! He turns to swerve, but too late, the car heads over the Wounded, Peloquin crawls off.
Dirt falls from the roof. Headlights appear.
The car slides into the earth. The guns stacked behind hi forward. KANE: Oh my Jesus!

Kane's car drops through the roof of Midian, falling thro core, breaking bridges as it falls. Breed are thrown off their deaths. The car strikes the top of Baphomet's chamb plume of fire, followed by several small explosions, mark death.
The explosions rock the chamber. Dirt falls. Baphomet loo the roof, with great sadness on his face.

Boone enters the initiation chamber. Lylesburg is standin the bowl of Baphomet's blood, which is bubbling furiously BOONE: What the hell are you doing down here? We need hel LYLESBURG: This was intended. BOONE: Fuck that! We're not going to lie down and die. LYLESBURG: It's Baphomet's will. He's going to destroy th and us. Everything, in one last fire. BOONE: How do you know? LYLESBURG: Look for yourself. He points to the bowl. BOONE: It's going to blow? LYLESBURG: Yes. BOONE: He'll destroy his own people? LYLESBURG: Better it ends quickly. We can't escape them. them of the darkness in themselves. They hate that. BOONE: So did I. I learned better. We can make it out. Bu fighters. LYLESBURG: We're not warriors... BOONE: What about the Berserkers? LYLESBURG: They're uncontrollable. BOONE: All the better. Let them out. Don't just stand the We're the tribes of the moon, remember? Doubt and fear mingle in Lylesburg's look, but he finally head. LYLESBURG: I'll release the Berserkers. BOONE: Be quick. We haven't got forever. Yet. Lylesburg smiles. Boone leaves. The Drummer is at the doo BOONE: You come with me. The rest of you get out of here. He exits with the Drummer.
The posse enter in large numbers, firing to left and righ Breed shot down.

Boone races to the entrance, to see Eigerman's posse movi the Necropolis. One of the posse has a flame thrower. He foliage. From Boone's P.O.V. we view the enemy: grinning monsters. There's no way out in this direction.
Lori looks towards the conflagration. LORI: Oh Jesus, Boone. Behind her, we see a familiar, masked figure approaching: She doesn't hear him over the shouts and screams.

One of the posse fires a rocket into a giant Breed who ex Boone reacts with horror at the destruction. When he turn sees Breed watching too, defenceless. BOONE: Arm yourselves! Defend yourselves! You're not catt Christ's sake. They don't have any right to kill you! He races back the way he came, and pulls coffins from the tearing their lids off with supernatural strength. He bre into clubs. The Breed watch him. BOONE: Weapons! You need weapons or it's over! One or two understand, and do as he's doing. BOONE: All of you! They do as he orders. BOONE: Stop them getting in! They'll kill the children!

Lori turns to see Decker appearing from the darkness. He her, cutting her arm. She backs away before he can strike time, retreating towards the gates. Then she turns and wa the reeds; Decker on her heels.
The posse led by Pettine invade the entrances to the Necr engaging in hand-to-hand combat with the Breed.
Boone races through the Necropolis, finding that other po members are breaking in from other sides. BOONE: They're everywhere!

The Nightbreed children hear the sound of slaughter appro of the Breed with enormous, dark eyes, speaks. LEOPARDO: We can't stay here. NARCISSE: He told us to. LEOPARDO: He can't help us. He's too late.
We see the posse shooting Breed as they move towards the Several are entering doorways that lead underground.
Posse enter the core, firing at anything that moves.
Lylesburg, his leg broken, is hobbling towards the Berser chamber, as the sound of gunfire gets nearer.

Narcisse still keeps an increasingly panicked group of Br children from scattering. Pettine and two bloodied, grinning posse appear through t PETTINE: Look what we got here! A freak-show nursery scho The group back away, but two more posse members appear, o flame-thrower, another with grenades. PETTINE: Say goodnight. BOONE [from above]: Goodnight. Pettine looks up. Framed against the stars, Boone. He dro Pettine breaking the man's neck. Then he and Narcisse lea against the posse, dispatching them all. NARCISSE: What way's safe? BOONE: The west wall! But be quick! I'm going after Eiger

Leroy and Lude hide around the corner of a mausoleum. Two members are beating a Breed up with their rifle butts. Le out to help. LUDE: What's the plan? LEROY: The usual. You take the big guy. [he yells to the Hey! They turn. Leroy raises his hands in surrender. LEROY: I wouldn't do that if I were you. 1ST POSSE: Give me a good reason why not. LEROY: I'll give you two! The snakes emerge from his body. 1ST POSSE: Shit! He raises his gun, but Lude flips over his head, landing and in front of the 2nd posse member. Lude's eyes blaze. LUDE: Pretty gun. The 2nd posse member looks down at his hands. The gun is snakes. He drops the gun. When he looks up Lude has gone. again, backing off towards a monument. Lude is there, a l hidden amongst the carved variety. He takes hold of the m him round and driving his horns into the man's neck. He s back, blood pouring from the opened wounds. Leroy, meanwhile, draws the 1st into an embrace. The snak Poisoned, the man dies. LEROY: Look at this mess. LUDE: Just like the old days.

Kane leads two cops through the mayhem, firing to right a shoots a Breed against one of the mausoleums. Blood is sp his face. KANE: Look at these bastards. Fucking freaks. He wipes the blood from his face. Then he takes off his s and wipes the blood off them. As he does so 1st cop yelps 1ST COP: Yow! KANE: What? 1st cop pulls a quill from the back of his neck. 1ST COP: Where the fuck did that come from? Kane puts his spectacles back on, and sees Shuna Sassi in mausoleums. She moves sexily in the shadows. Kane grins a approach. 2ND COP: Wait... KANE: It's just a girl... 1st cop is still rubbing the back of his neck. He is look 1ST COP: I don't...feel...so...good... Kane pushes the mausoleum grille open, as the 1st cop kne face down. The 2nd cop kneels to help him. Meanwhile, Kane has stepped into the mausoleum. Shuna is in the corn spines covered with the swaths of red cloth. KANE: It's OK, Baby. He lowers his gun. Outside the 2nd cop turns the 1st over frothing at the mouth, his face blotchy and sweating. 2ND COP: Oh shit! Kane! Inside again, Shuna drops her cloth and leaps at Kane. 2n approaches the mausoleum. 2ND COP: Kane? As he reaches the threshold, Kane staggers out, his body pierced in dozens of places with Shuna's spines. He reach cop. 2ND COP: Keep away from me! In panic, he fires at Kane, who falls to the ground. As t clears a hand appears and strokes his cheek. He turns. It screams, and falls to the ground at her feet, his arm cov spines. He twitches, and dies. She drops her swath of red the faces of the three dead men.

Cut to Eigerman's leering, grinning face as he fires at B Ashberry emerges from the shadows and grabs him. ASHBERRY:. Please, you've got to stop...[takes out a pist it) There's children down there, you're killing children! EIGERMAN: Go ahead, faggot, [pauses contemptuously] You h the balls to pull the trigger. Eigerman snatches the gun away and pistol-whips him to th Eigerman draws a bead on Ashberry's forehead. EIGERMAN [cont.]: Lemme show you how it's done... Nearby, Joyce sees them, draws his weapon, ready to fire Eigerman when a shadow passes over him. He ducks, his exp changing from horror to wonder. ASHBERRY [eyes closed-hands clasped fervently]: Father, I heartily sorry for having offended thee... EIGERMAN: Sorry, Padre. Nobody's listening...[prepares to BOONE [V.O.]: I hear you. Eigerman turns, looks and fires as Boone leaps at him. He effortlessly picks Eigerman up and body-slams him against Midian. BOONE [cont.] [to Ashberry]: Get up! ASHBERRY: Don't kill me! BOONE: Run, go on! We don't like priests here. Ashberry pulls at his collar, tears it off, clings to Boo ASHBERRY: No, no, take me, I have to see. Boone gets a sense of his commitment. He heads off. head_text.subj: EXT. NECROPOLIS NEAR THE GATES NIGHT

text: With the tide turning inside the Necropolis, a disorganiz is underway. Eigerman is at the gate watching the remains 'army' staggering away. Joyce is watching the scene. EIGERMAN: Stand your ground! Stand your ground! They've g this way. We can mow 'em down. He climbs up on a vehicle which is parked at the gates. I driving seat is Gibbs. Back at the gate we see one of the escaping Berserkers fl car over, while his brothers dispatch posse members. The simply drop their weapons and flee.

Chaos, and collapse. Earth is falling all around. Lori pi up and finds her way back up is blocked by debris. She ha but to cross the swaying walkways, while the air thickens and smoke. head_text.subj: INT. ENTRANCE TO MURAL CHAMBER NIGHT

text: Peloquin pushes Lori ahead of him. PELOQUIN: See? We track towards the mural. Lori can barely believe her e laid out on the walls, is a whole history; and featured a more recent additions, the face of Boone. PELOQUIN: Yes, it's him. Boone squatting in front of his fire of love letters. Boo the reeds. PELOQUIN: All these years waiting for a saviour. But he h us. He's destroyed us. I made him, and he's destroyed us. LORI: Made him? PELOQUIN: The bite was mine. The bite that mocks death. LORI: That doesn't make him yours. I belong here on this as much as you do. Why aren't I here? PELOQUIN: You're still a Natural. Go back while you've st life. Join your tribe. LORI: That? My tribe? Not any longer. PELOQUIN: Then die with us. It's over. Peloquin exits. Lori looks back at the images on the wall more. Then she exits.

Boone, Joyce and Babette approach the hole where Lori fel BABETTE: Let me down. I can't go any further. BOONE: Why not? BABETTE [looking down into the hole]: Baphomet. BOONE [to Joyce]: Take her. Run. Joyce nods and moves off with her into the smoke. As she Decker steps forward from the smoke. DECKER: Quite a dance, huh? Death everywhere and you and middle. Catch! He throws the head of a Breed at Boone. DECKER: Even the dead can die! Then Decker strikes out at him, slashing at Boone's face. falls backwards. At the last moment he catches hold of De pulling him down into the hole and together they tumble i earth.

Decker closes on him, the knives at his force of his stabs, which miss Boone's neck, break the bo bridge. Boone braces his feet beneath Decker and tosses h Decker gets up and approaches him again, slashing the rop bridge with his blades as he comes. The fighters connect struggle, their violent motion carrying them over the edg bridge, dropping them down another level. Decker lands ve and lies still. Boone gets up. His exit along the bridge direction is blocked. He has to step past Decker who does move. Only when Boone has stepped beyond him does Decker pursuing Boone across the bridge, and flinging one of the knives at his victim's back. The blade cuts straight thro sticking out from his chest a good six inches. He turns, transforming him into a more extreme creature. Decker com with a second blade, slashing at Boone's neck. The battle them off the bridge onto the stairs. Decker takes hold of hair, preparing to deliver the coup de grace. Boone reach weapon, finds a skull, and smashes it into the mask. Deck Boone tumbles off the stairs, falling face down on a card Decker follows down the stairs. Boone pulls the table off leaving the Ace of Hearts on the blade in his chest. Decker takes a whip from the wall and us disarm Boone, who has snatched up a bone to defend himsel Boone snatches up a second bone and retaliates, deliverin blow against Decker, eventually knocking the knife from h driving him out on to the ledge once more. Decker teeters edge, now defenceless. Boone approaches. BOONE: Want to dance? He snatches the mask off Decker's face and draws him clos Decker on his own blade. Decker screams. Then Boone pushes him off the blade, and over the edge of Decker falls. Boone stands on the ledge, and spits down at the corpse. so he hears the same roar from Baphomet that called the Berserkers from harming him. Out of it, comes Baphomet's BAPHOMET [V.O.]: Boone!

The chamber is empty of life. There are two or three corp floor. We approach the central dais, on which is perched of Baphomet, surrounded by six white heads. Momentarily, light break from the statue's head and strike the white h in turn begin to glow...
In the chambers we've seen before we see copies of the si in front of which are bowls of Baphomet's fluid...They be the brightness building. Sparks rise from the fluid.

Lori sits, exhausted, in the corridor. She looks up to se with the knife still transfixing him. LORI: My God... BOONE: Decker's dead. Take the knife out. Lori pulls the knife from him, and throws it down. BAPHOMET [V.O.]: Boone! LORI: Don't go... BOONE: I'm. responsible. I have to. Lori and Boone head down the corridor, passing Ashberry, standing in the shadows. Lori and Boone head down the stairs towards the chamber.

Blinding light. As Boone descends into the chamber, he se Nightbreed, surviving members of a Senior Council, Rachel standing around Baphomet. They are wrapping severed limbs Baphomet, preparing to include him in the exodus. His hea shoulders remain suspended in the light. Baphomet's lips a terrible, eloquent sound. Rachel translates, the deep v coming from her lips. RACHEL/BAPHOMET: Come closer... Boone obeys. Baphomet's remaining arm reaches down and ho as Baphomet's face stares down at him. RACHEL/BAPHOMET: ...You have destroyed our refuge... BOONE: I never meant... Baphomet silences him. Boone trembles but maintains eye c RACHEL/BAPHOMET: This was foretold. No refuge is forever. are charged . . . BOONE: Yes... RACHEL/BAPHOMET: ...You must rebuild what you've destroye BOONE: Where? RACHEL/BAPHOMET: That you must find yourself. In the worl BOONE: I don't...I don't know how... RACHEL/BAPHOMET: You shall not be alone. You will find me heal me. [holds him close] You are not Boone... And now the words emerge from Baphomet himself, shaking t BAPHOMET: ...you are Cabal! Boone/Cabal is released. Baphomet is consumed in light. T move towards him to finish their task. LORI [O.S.]: Boone? Boone/Cabal turns; Lori stands at the bottom of the slope a hand. He takes it, they start up the slope. Cowering in a niche inside the chamber, out of sight, wat wonder is Ashberry. Transfixed by Baphomet, he crosses hi Boone/Cabal glances back. The Council receive pieces of B from the light wrapping his smoking fragments in shrouds. The light builds to its brightest level. Pieces begin to fall.
The bowls start to explode with sparks of white light.
Boone/Cabal and Lori race up towards the surface, as Midi continues to collapse around them.

Ashberry descends the stairs into the blaze of light. Tea down his cheeks. He watches as the Council prepare to take down Baphomet's Near to him is one of the bowls of Baphomet's light. Ashb approaches it, hungry for a taste of this glory. He reach the bowl. As he does so Baphomet's eyes fix on him. The b the air. The fluid it holds rains down on Ashberry like a falls back, his body smoking.
Boone/Cabal and Lori reach the surface and race through t Necropolis, flames all around them. And then, behind them
The tentacles attached to Baphomet's head are detached. The blaze of light instantly begins to diminish...
The lights start to go out in the core, and earth begins from the tunnels. We see it flood the various corridors, with a shuddering
We glimpse Baphomet's head being covered by the Council, roars increase...

Boone/Cabal and Lori find Joyce, holding Babette, protect near the gates. Joyce steps back from the form of Rachel, who pulls her v her and holds out her arms. RACHEL: Give me my child... Joyce looks at Lori, Boone/Cabal, at Babette and Rachel. hands the child over. Rachel holds Babette and they both into the darkness. JOYCE [to Boone/Cabal]: ...I never understood...nobody ev He steps away from them and the night engulfs him.
The earth has almost obliterated the core entirely.
The roar ceases. Silence.

Lori and Boone stand in the reeds as the last, bright blo fires dies away on their faces. Figures move away through creatures we recognize. The drummer beats out a tattoo as Narcisse appears from the darkness. As he does so, a fina roars up from the underground. In the smoke pillar above Baphomet's image momentarily appears before the wind disp NARCISSE: Never piss off a God. Lori looks up into the sky.

Lori's P.O.V. of the sky, with other Breed, spirits of sm light, moving away into the night. LORI: Where are they going? NARCISSE: Any hiding place they can find. It'll be dawn s BOONE: When I need you where will I find you? NARCISSE: You'll find me. And you will need me. He reaches to shake Boone's hand. NARCISSE: Never touched a legend before. He laughs his manic laugh. NARCISSE [cont.] [to Lori]: Good night, pretty. He fades into the night, the laughter going with him.

In the distance, the burning ruins of Midian. The wind si moonlit reeds. Cabal and Lori reach the top of the hill, look down, standing apart. CABAL: I'll have to start tonight. LORI: I'll go with you, Boone. CABAL: I'm not Boone, Lori. Do you understand? I belong t now. LORI: Then make me belong too; they made you one of them, it to me... CABAL: I can't... LORI: I want to be with you. CABAL: I'll come back for you when I'm finished... LORI: And when's that gonna be, when I'm ninety and you'r way you are? I went through hell to find you and you just, just walk away from me? [pause; broken-hearted] Wel then, just go. Go on! What more do you want? Leave me som for Christ's sake! Pause. She turns away, trying not to show him her pain. C to go. Lori turns back, sees him going. She can't bear it around, sees Decker's briefcase lying beside the police c it, finds a knife. LORI: Boone! He turns. She puts the blade to her belly and drives it i CABAL: Lori, NO! She cries out and sinks to the ground in terrible pain. H her and holds her in his arms. LORI: I lied, I lied, you're all I want. CABAL: Don't die, God, Lori, don't die... LORI: Well why don't you do something about it, God damn remember what you said...[fading]...quickly... He raises her neck to his mouth. Her eyes flicker closed. A fatal, bloody kiss. He rises from her. Her eyes are clo CABAL: ...too late?...Oh God, too late... Her eyes open. She's turned. LORI: You said you'd never leave me. She grins, presses up to kiss his bloodied mouth. Camera off them to find the moon and we:

We track through the ruins of the Necropolis. The walls a blackened by fires that are almost extinguished; corpses Breed] lie in barely distinguishable bundles, from which cremated limbs jut. Smoke hangs in the air. From the dist Eigerman, going amongst the corpses, reclaiming guns, bul grenades. As we get closer we realize that he is a broken face dirty, his eyes lunatic. He's been crying, the track the dirt. Suddenly, he hears a noise, and stands up to see a large appearing from the smoke. He goes for his own gun, levell the figure as it approaches. EIGERMAN: Keep your distance! The figure keeps coming, emerging from the smoke. It's As has been transformed by the confrontation with Baphomet. been almost burned away entirely and there is a subtle reconfiguration in the shape of his skull. His clothes ar tatters. There are hints that his once broken body, poiso alcohol, has taken on new strength. He looks as insane as but stronger in his lunacy. There's a dangerous fervour i ASHBERRY: I saw their God...I saw him... EIGERMAN: What the hell are you talking about? ASHBERRY: I can still smell him. He's out there... Ashberry walks past Eigerman towards the exit from Necrop EIGERMAN: You mean you can find them? ASHBERRY: Oh yes. EIGERMAN: We'll go together then. You can lead me to the Then I'll wipe them all away. ASHBERRY: No. They're mine. Their God burned me. I want t back. All of them. Burn them all away. EIGERMAN: You can't, you don't have the wits ... Ashberry turns on him, his face wild. He takes hold of Ei the neck, his fingers digging into the muscle. Blood runs tries to raise the gun but Ashberry takes hold of the man summarily snaps his wrist. The gun is dropped. Ashberry s lift Eigerman up off the ground. The policeman's flailing suddenly. The head lolls. Ashberry flings the body aside, out of the Necropolis. As he approaches the exit he looks Sunlight falls on his face.
Shining, full. We move down to find a derelict barn, stan in a vast field.

We track through the darkness to find Rachel, Babette, Ki number of other refugees and children of Midian, staring night. BABETTE: ...who will come for us? KINSKI: His name is Cabal. He unmade Midian. BABETTE: How soon? RACHEL: On the next wind. If not tonight, then tomorrow. Babette gazes out over the cornfields. BABETTE: On the next wind...
Cabal and Lori, standing on the hill, against a backgroun BABETTE [V.O.]: ...if not tonight...tomorrow...

Moving through the ruined chambers, illuminated by dying flame, we find and track along the end of the heroic mosa tells, in a rush of images, the story of the ruin of Midi Camera comes to a stop on the final image: Cabal and Lori just saw them, on a hill, framed against the star-filled The sound of the wind... Fade to black.
